ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Optimize URL scheduling?

Christian Kohlschuetter wrote:

> Dear all,
> ...
>
> I think, decoupling the crawling and link-enqueueing stages (= making 
> them run
> in parallel), could reduce the overall delay and improve crawling
> performance: Couldn't the Postselector simply enqueue all extracted Links
> (including duplicates -- ie. no deduping overhead) to a Thread-Local,
> disk-backed queue ("postprocess-queue")? Another Thread/pool of 
> Threads would
> then dequeue items from that queue and try to schedule them (doing the
> already-seen test and enqueue them into the ready-queue).

Its an idea worth trying.  We may just end up moving the traffic jam to 
a new location.  On the other hand, there may be some rough balance 
struck -- between toethread pool and dequeuing pool -- where overall 
throughput is raised (I've added your suggestion Christian to the RFE 
that covers the phenomeon you describe: 'Threads underutilized: decrease 
frontier lock contention': 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539099&func=detail&aid=965395).

St.Ack
